questions.text: Regarding the given box-whisker plot, the true statement is:
questions.solution:
Correct Option A-Mean > Median > Mode :

Option A states that the mean is greater than the median, and the median is greater than the mode, implying a positively skewed distribution. In such distributions, the tail extends towards higher values, affecting the mean more than the median. The mode represents the most common value(s), which can be lower than the mean and median in this scenario.

Incorrect Options: B, C & D

questions.text: What is the most appropriate measure of central tendency when there is a diverse range of values within a community?
questions.solution:
Correct Options C - Median:

  • The median serves as the most accurate indicator of central tendency in groups where values span a wide spectrum.
  • A data set's median is the value in the middle, with half of the values being greater than the median and the other half being less than the median. Extreme values or outliers, which have a significant impact on the mean, have no effect on the median.

Incorrect Options

  • Option A: Extreme values or outliers in the data set have an impact on the mean because they can significantly deviate the mean value from the majority of the data. 
  • Option B: Another way to measure central tendency is by using the mode, but this method is not appropriate for continuous data or data with a wide range of values. 
  • Option D: The standard deviation is not a measure of central tendency; rather, it is a measure of variability or spread in the data.

questions.text: What is the best way to use a graphical representation to illustrate patterns and changes in the occurrence of diarrheal disease within a specific region?
questions.solution:
Correct Option A: Line graph

  • A line graph is the best way to plot trends in the incidence of diarrheal disease in a given area. 

A line graph effectively displays trends in diarrheal disease incidence over time. It utilizes an X-axis for time (e.g., years) and a Y-axis for incidence rate (e.g., cases per 100,000). By connecting data points with lines, it provides a clear visualization of changing trends and patterns in disease incidence

Incorrect Options:

Option B: Histogram

  • Histograms are useful for analyzing large datasets and identifying patterns or trends.

Option C: Ogive

  • An ogive, or cumulative frequency curve visually illustrates how cumulative frequency increases with rising variable values..

Option D: Tree diagram

  • A tree diagram visually represents potential outcomes of a choice or process.

questions.text: The chi-square test is used to test the significance of the association between:

choices.text: Heart rate and body mass index
Weight of a patient before and after a treatment

questions.solution:
Correct Option C-Sex and type of cancer :

"Sex and type of cancer," is the correct choice for applying the Chi-square test. This involves investigating whether there's a significant association between the variables "sex" (male or female) and "type of cancer" (e.g., lung, breast). The test compares observed frequencies in a contingency table to expected frequencies under the assumption of independence between variables, determining if the association is statistically significant.

Incorrect Options: 

Option A (Age and serum cholesterol level): The association between age and serum cholesterol level would typically be analyzed using correlation or regression analysis rather than the Chi-square test.

Option B (Heart rate and body mass index): Similarly, the association between heart rate and body mass index would be more appropriately analyzed using correlation or regression analysis.

Option D (Weight of a patient before and after treatment): The comparison of weight before and after treatment would typically be analyzed using paired t-tests or other appropriate statistical tests, depending on the specific research design and assumptions.

questions.text: You have gone to a sub center as part of an audit. How many infants should be registered in a year with a health worker working there?
questions.solution:
Correct Option C.

  • 150: This option states that 150 infants should be registered in a year with a health worker at the subcenter. This number is a more reasonable estimate and aligns with the expected workload of a subcenter. It allows for adequate monitoring and provision of healthcare services to a considerable number of infants within a year.

Incorrect Options:

Option A. 50: This number seems quite low considering the population and the expected workload of a subcenter.

Option B. 100: Subcenters often serve a larger population and aim to provide comprehensive healthcare to a significant number of infants.

Option D. 200: While this number is higher than the other options, it may be on the higher side for a typical subcenter. The workload of a health worker at the sub center needs to be balanced to ensure quality care and effective management of healthcare services.

questions.text: Please observe the provided image and choose the linear regression equation that matches the displayed graph.
questions.solution:
Correct Option C- which is y = 11 + 2x. :

In the given graph, the relationship between the x and y variables appears to be a linear relationship, with a positive slope. The equation y = 11 + 2x represents this relationship accurately. It suggests that for every unit increase in x, y increases by 2 units, and the line intersects the y-axis at 11.

 

Incorrect Options:

 

Option A. y = 10 – x: This equation represents a line with a negative slope, which is not consistent with the positive slope observed in the graph.

Option B. x = 10 + y: This equation represents a line with a slope of 1, where x increases by 1 unit for every unit increase in y. This is not consistent with the slope observed in the graph.

Option D. x = 11 + 2y: This equation represents a line with a slope of 1/2, where x increases by 1 unit for every 2 unit increase in y. This is not consistent with the slope observed in the graph.

questions.text: Study A(red) and Study B(blue) done in a given population yields two different distribution curves as shown below. Comparing both the curves, which of the following will be true?

choices.text: Mean = median, not equal to mode
Mode = median, not equal to mean

questions.solution:
Correct Option B-Mean = median, not equal to mode :

  • Option B suggests that the mean is equal to the median, but not equal to the mode for both Study A and Study B. This option indicates that the distribution curves have a symmetric shape, where the mean and median are located at the center, but the mode may differ. This option aligns with the information provided and is the correct answer.

Incorrect Options: 

Option A. Mean = mode = median:

  • Option A suggests that the measures of central tendency are equal for both Study A and Study B. However, this conclusion may not be accurate based on the provided information and the comparison of the curves.

Option C. Mean, median, mode not equal:

  • Option C implies that the central tendency measures differ between Study A and Study B, indicating varied shapes and positions of their distribution curves. However, this conclusion may not be accurate given the provided details and the need to compare the curves.

Option D. Mode = median, not equal to mean:

  • Option D proposes that the mode equals the median but not the mean for both Study A and Study B. However, this conclusion might not be accurate given the provided details and curve comparison.

questions.text: The margin of error will vary according to the sample sizes, with sample 1 having the largest size of 1000, followed by sample 2 with a size of 800, and sample 3 with the smallest size of 600.
questions.solution:
Correct Option A- 3>2>1

A smaller standard deviation indicates less dispersion, while a larger standard deviation suggests greater dispersion. Increased standard deviation means more spread in the dataset, making it less reliable. Conversely, lower standard deviation implies less spread and increased reliability. Therefore, first set is more reliable than the third set in this graph.

questions.text: A study was conducted on two different samples for comparing variation between DBP and Vitamin D. The mean diastolic blood pressure is 110 with standard deviation 11 and the mean vitamin D level is 18 with standard deviation 3. Which of the following statement is true regarding the coefficient of variation (CV)?

choices.text: CV of DBP is more than Vitamin D
CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP
Both DBP and Vitamin D have equal variability
It cannot be ascertained from information provided

questions.solution:
Correct Option B:

  • The coefficient of variation (CV) of DBP is more than Vitamin D.
  • In this scenario, the mean diastolic blood pressure (DBP) is 110 with a standard deviation of 11, and the mean vitamin D level is 18 with a standard deviation of 3.
    • CV of DBP = (11 / 110) * 100 = 10%
    • CV of Vitamin D = (3 / 18) * 100 ≈ 16.67%
  • Comparing the CV values, we can see that the CV of DBP (10%) is lower than the CV of Vitamin D (16.67%). Thus, Option B- CV of Vitamin D is more than that of DBP is correct. 

Incorrect Options: 

Option A. states that the CV of  DBP is more than Vitamin D, which is incorrect based on the calculated CV values.

Option C. suggests that both DBP and Vitamin D have equal variability, which is also incorrect since the CV values differ.

Option D. states that it cannot be ascertained from the information provided, but we can determine the relative variability based on the given data.

questions.text: To analyze the seasonal fluctuations of a disease in children, two groups were observed. One group was studied from June to July, while the other group, with similar characteristics, was observed from August to September. The appropriate statistical test to compare the data would be:
questions.solution:
Correct Option. A-Chi square:

  • The Chi-square test assesses association or difference between two categorical variables, commonly used to compare frequencies or proportions between groups.
  • In this case, the seasonal variations of a disease in two different groups (June to July group and August to September group) can be compared using the Chi-square test to determine if there is a significant difference in disease occurrence between the two time periods.

Incorrect Options:

Option B. Paired t-test: The paired t-test is used to compare the means of two related groups or to assess the difference between two measurements taken on the same group at different time points.

Option C. Wilcoxon test: The Wilcoxon test compares two independent groups when data aren't normally distributed or when t-test assumptions aren't met. It's for continuous variables, not categorical data or seasonal disease variations.

Option D. ANOVA (Analysis of Variance): ANOVA is a statistical test used to compare means among three or more groups.

questions.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the findings of a well-designed cancer study that obtained similar remission rates of 33.2% for both a new treatment and the usual treatment, with a p-value of 0.04?

choices.text: Both the treatments are equally effective
Neither of the treatments is effective
The new treatment is more effective than the usual treatment
The information given is not adequate to compare the efficacy of the treatments

questions.solution:
Correct Option C - The new treatment is more effective than the usual treatment.

  • A p-value of 0.04 suggests a 4% chance of obtaining observed results, or more extreme results, if the null hypothesis is true. With a significance level of 0.05, results are statistically significant if the p-value is less than this threshold. Since 0.04 is below 0.05, we reject the null hypothesis, concluding the new treatment is more effective. While similar remission rates could be chance, statistical analysis indicates this difference isn't solely due to randomness..

Incorrect Options:

Option A - Both the treatments are equally effective: The p-value of 0.04 signifies a significant difference between treatments, suggesting they aren't equally effective.

Option B - Neither of the treatments is effective:The study didn't assess treatment effectiveness but compared remission rates between them. Since both treatments had identical remission rates, we can't conclude their ineffectiveness from this data..

Option D - The information given is not adequate to compare the efficacy of the treatments: The p-value of 0.04 indicates a statistically significant difference in remission rates between treatments, implying a meaningful efficacy difference.

questions.text: Which of the following statements accurately describes non-parametric tests?

choices.text: ANOVA is an example of a non-parametric test
It is used for skewed distributions
It involves the assumption that the data has a normal distribution
It cannot be used for small sample sizes

questions.solution:
Correct Option B: It is used for skewed distributions- Non-parametric tests are commonly used for skewed distributions. Unlike parametric tests, which make assumptions about the underlying distribution of the data (such as a normal distribution), non-parametric tests do not rely on these assumptions. Instead, they are designed to analyze data that may not meet the requirements of parametric tests, such as when the data is not normally distributed or when the data is ordinal or categorical.

Incorrect Options:

Option A: ANOVA is an example of a non-parametric test-  ANOVA (Analysis of Variance) is an example of a parametric test, not a non-parametric test.

Option C: It involves the assumption that the data has a normal distribution- non-parametric tests do not assume that the data has a normal distribution. In fact, they are specifically used when the data does not meet the assumption of normality.

Option D: It cannot be used for small sample sizes: It is incorrect because non-parametric tests can be used with small sample sizes.

questions.text: What is the most effective approach to graphically represent the variations in the occurrence of a disease within a specific geographical region throughout a period of time?
questions.solution:
Correct Option:

Option A - Line graph: A line graph is the most suitable choice for representing changes in incidence over time.

  • It displays disease incidence trends over time using connected data points. The x-axis shows chronological time, while the y-axis represents incidence rate or case numbers. The line illustrates how disease incidence changes, aiding in trend, pattern, and fluctuation identification.

 Incorrect Options:

Option B - Histogram: A histogram is effective for showing data distribution but isn't ideal for visualizing changes in disease incidence over time since it doesn't capture temporal aspects.

Option C - Ogive: An ogive aids in understanding cumulative data distribution but isn't suitable for depicting changes in disease incidence over time as it lacks clarity in temporal trends and patterns.

OptionD - Tree diagram: A tree diagram isn't suitable for showing changes in disease incidence over time as it doesn't capture temporal aspects or display quantitative data in a time series format.

questions.text: What is the purpose of conducting a significance test for two or more proportions?
questions.solution:
Correct Option A-Chi-square test :

  • The Chi-square test is used to assess the association or difference between categorical variables.
  • In the case of comparing proportions, the chi-square test can be applied to analyze contingency tables or cross-tabulations of categorical data.
  • It determines if the observed proportions differ significantly from the expected proportions under the null hypothesis of no association or difference.

 

Incorrect Options :

Options B. Student's test:The t-test compares means between two groups and isn't suitable for comparing proportions because it deals with continuous, not categorical, data.

Options C. Z test:The Z test compares proportions with a known population standard deviation, assuming a normal distribution, which isn't always practical since standard deviations are often unknown in real-world scenarios.

Options D. ANOVA test: ANOVA compares means across multiple groups but isn't suitable for comparing proportions, which are categorical variables.

questions.text: What is the preferred test for evaluating the disparity in means between two groups in a study, where one group serves as the control?
questions.solution:
Correct Option C-Unpaired T test :

Options C. Unpaired T test:The independent samples T test, or unpaired T test, compares means of two independent groups. It's used for continuous data that are roughly normally distributed and commonly applied in studies with a control group to evaluate group differences.

 

Incorrect Options:

Options A. Chi-square test: The chi-square test is used to determine the association between categorical variables.

Options B. Z test: The Z test is used to compare means when the population standard deviation is known.

OptionsD. Paired T test: The paired T test, also known as the dependent samples T test, is used when comparing means of related or paired data.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a measure of Dispersion?
questions.solution:
Correct Option - D: Mean

The mean is a measure of central tendency and not a measure of dispersion. To obtain the mean, the individual observations are first added together and then divided by the number of observations.

Incorrect Options:

Option A - Standard error- Standard error is a measure of the variability or dispersion of sample means around the population mean.

Option B - Variance- Variance is a measure of dispersion that quantifies the spread of data points around the mean.

Option C - Range- Range is a measure of dispersion that indicates the difference between the highest and lowest values in a dataset.
